meanings.sent1: I bejumble my thoughts when I try to do too many things at once.
meanings.sent2: Please do not bejumble the order of the steps in the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The magician bejumbled the cards so much that even he couldn't find the right one!
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a bejumbled puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent5: The bejumbled colors in the painting created a chaotic yet intriguing effect.

meanings.sent1: Let's bejumble all the toys in the box and see what we can create.
meanings.sent2: The wind bejumbled the leaves on the ground, making a colorful mess.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to bejumble their snacks and ended up with a strange but tasty combination.
meanings.sent4: The artist bejumbled different art styles to create a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The bejumbled sounds of the city at night made it hard to fall asleep.

meanings.sent1: The mischievous puppy bejumbled the papers on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The storm bejumbled the neatly arranged garden into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally bejumbled the ingredients and created a new dish by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The hikers got bejumbled in the dense forest and lost their way.
meanings.sent5: The bejumbled letters in the crossword puzzle made it challenging to solve.
